basics.name: Abderrahmane Ait gueni ssaid
basics.label: Computer science student
basics.summary: Aspiring computer science student eager to embark on a research internship journey in machine learning and deep learning.

Work.name: Grenoble Informatics Laboratory
Work.position: Research Intern - Integrating information retrieval (IR) constraints in deep neural networks
Work.Team: APTIKAL - Algorithms, Principles and TheorIes for collaborative Knowledge acquisition And Learning
Work.summary: Worked on the reformulation of IR axioms into the neural framework

Work.name: Grenoble Institute of Neurosciences
Work.position: Research Intern - Integration of multi-parametric data by machine learning for the development of an imaging biomarker in epilepsy
Work.summary: one day a week from 01/02/2022 to 15/05/2022 then full time.

Work.name: Grenoble Informatics Laboratory
Work.position: Research Intern - Data Augmentation with Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for Semi-supervised Learning
Work.Team: APTIKAL - Algorithms, Principles and TheorIes for collaborative Knowledge acquisition And Learning
Work.summary: Work on a new semi-supervised model for the prediction of phase and Euler angles in microscopic data.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: Operating systems design and concurrent programming
Introduction to AI and Data Science
Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction and event-based programming

skills: Java, Python, SQL, Shell, Linux, Git, Java RMI, RabbitMQ, Docker, LaTex, GDB, Valgrind, Google test, Jetbrains, OpenMP, Open MPI, TensorFlow, Pytorch, NumPy, SciKit-Learn, SciPy, Pandas, Keras, Matplotlib, OpenCV, BeautifulSoup

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
